passage_text: [ 2 syll. va-dim, vad-im ] The baby boy name Vadim is pronounced as Vaa-D IY-M †. Vadim is of Old Norse and Slavonic origin. It is used mainly in Russian. The name is of obscure origin; it could be derived from Old Norse. In addition, Vadim is a variant form of the Czech, English, and Hungarian Vladimir vladimír in The russian. language

In Russian, the name Vadim means-a powerful ruler.The name Vadim originated as an Russian name. In Russian, the name Vadim means-a powerful ruler.The name Vadim originated as an Russian name. The name Vadim is most often used as a boy name or male name.

Variant forms of Vadim include the name Vad, the name Vadeem, the name Vadeeme, the name Vadem, the Russian Vadik, the name Vadime, the name Vadym, and the name Vadyme. Vadim is not commonly used as a baby boy name. It is not in the top 1000 names.

The first thing you should know if you are considering Vadim for your baby's name is that in most countries all over the world the name Vadim is a boy name.
